thread.title: Not holding back: Browns' Joe Thomas is the hero NFL fans need
thread.title_full: Not holding back: Browns' Joe Thomas is the hero NFL fans need

author: Shutdown Corner
title: Not holding back: Browns' Joe Thomas is the hero NFL fans need
text:
Cleveland Browns left tackle Joe Thomas might be the best player in the NFL, but thanks to the fact that he’s A. a tackle, and B. on the perennially sad Browns, he’s not really a household name.
But we’re here to tell you: Thomas might be the hero NFL fans need.
It’s not just for his play – the 10-year veteran has been chosen a first- or second-team All-Pro every year he’s been in the league – but for his willingness, in a league known for players more often than not towing the league line, for being unafraid to speak his mind.
Cleveland Browns LT Joe Thomas. (AP) More The most recent example: on Thursday’s “PFT Live,” Thomas gave his reaction to the Super Bowl LI trophy presentation.
“I especially enjoyed how over-eager Roger was to smile at all the Patriots and give them a big handshake, but then as soon as he gave them the trophy he scurried off the stage like a rat. It was awesome,” Thomas said.
In the days after the Super Bowl matchup was set, Thomas tweeted that even though he’d love to see his friend and former teammate Alex Mack (now the Falcons’ center) win a Super Bowl, he would “sure love” to see NFL commissioner Roger Goodell hand the trophy to Tom Brady. He later told ESPN’s “Mike & Mike” show that he loves awkward situations; Goodell handing the trophy to Brady, whom he suspended four games for his alleged involvement in deflate-gate certainly qualified.
Some other gems from Thomas, who also said on “PFT Live” that as he gets older, he’s less and less concerned with whether anyone has a problem with him expressing his opinions:
On whether Goodell might have had some, ahem, liquid courage before the trophy presentation on Sunday night:
Did it sound like @nflcommish may have been "easing the nerves" a bit before his meeting with Kraft and Brady tonight?
— Joe Thomas (@joethomas73) February 6, 2017
On 2014 Browns first-round pick Justin Gilbert, who was released by the Pittsburgh Steelers this week:
If you don't like football, it doesn't matter how talented you are, your star will burn out quick. https://t.co/r7PfDSTljL
— Joe Thomas (@joethomas73) February 6, 2017
On the Pro Bowl – and Cleveland’s terrible 1-15 season:
What a great pro bowl!! AFC wins and I double my yearly win total all in the same night!
— Joe Thomas (@joethomas73) January 30, 2017
On parenting:
Is it a faux pas if I take off my kids diaper, and upon noticing it's dry, fold it up and stow it in my back pocket for future use?
— Joe Thomas (@joethomas73) January 24, 2017
Keep dropping your truths and laughs, Joe.
More on Yahoo Sports:
• Former NBA enforcer Charles Oakley arrested at Knicks game
• Jerry Jones unsure how to resolve Tony Romo’s situation
• Steph Curry called President Trump an ‘ass’ without calling him an ‘ass’
• MLB plans to test radical new extra-innings rules
